People of victory

Ludy Victory Project -
Continuation of our successful " win-win " project. As we speak of the fate of the people whose lives have been affected by the war, we not only open new pages of the country ' s history, but we continue to create a media gallery of heroes that made this victory possible.

People of victory
08-05-2023

Boris Boytsov: " I changed my name and name to get on the front "

Boris Pavlovic Boytsov is a veteran of the Great Patriotic War, an honorary citizen of Petrozavodska, a professional photographer. Although he's 96 years old, he has a great sense of humor, goes to school and students, wrote a book of autobiography and driving a car. The driver's license was extended until 2028. That year he'll celebrate 101 birthdays. The veteran spoke about his book and his military fate on the eve of the Ruspublika Day.

People of victory
03-05-2023

Robon Petrozavodska: how Karelia restores memory of the massacres

The search unit, " On the footprints of the dead planes " , works in Karelia for the 36th year. This spring was a serious challenge for the participants: to find all the dead fighters from the village of village, village, where in 1941 the frontier of the defence of Petrozavodska. About what obstructed the beginning of excavation right now and what the searchers have done over the years, the Russpare has told the commander of the Mikhail Ganjin unit.

People of victory
04-10-2022

Five months in the left: how the undergrounders survived in Tuchin's house

The history of the underground movement in Carelia is closely linked to Sheltoserje, where a group of five persons landed on parachutes in August 1943. They settled in the village chief ' s house, scouted and agitated the local population to free the territory from Finnish invaders. Dmitri Tucin's house is a unique building that has many interesting objects and memory of victory in the Great Patriotic War.

People of victory
22-06-2022

June 41st. Unique veteran memoirs of war on the beginning of the Great Patriotic

Vladimir Petrovich Novovilov met a war student at the railway technician. In the first days, he was able to enter the front lane and cross with a group of Carel Bears. The Republic publishes the memories of the veteran in which the first days are re-established with documentary accuracy.

People of victory
08-05-2022

" We did not rejoin people " : the stories of the three survivors of the Finnish concessions

The young prisoners of Finnish camps are the people who have chosen their childhood. They learned cruelty, hunger and death at an early age. Today, three former prisoners tell us about life behind barbed wires and the release of Petrozavodska. On the eve of the 9th Day, Maya publishes a new edition of the Ludy Victor Special Project.

People of victory
07-05-2022

Secret combat

The victory in the war is not only for soldiers in front-line or armoured military factories, but also for those who risked their lives in the enemy's rear, getting valuable information. The new pre-launch of the Ludy Victor project is dedicated to the work of the Special Services on the Karel Front.

People of victory
12-04-2022

The glass came out of windows, which had to survive a resident of Petrozavodska during the war.

The people of the Winds have put heavy tests on their shoulders during the liberation of the Soviet Union from fascism. They show how to live to benefit the people and the country and inspire their optimism at all times. The history of a strong and fragile woman who survived the war childhood is described in our special project, Ludy Victory.

People of victory
26-10-2021

Say hello to Polechka: front letters helped find the soldier who died in Carelia.

Pavel Kuchin died on May 13, 1942 under the village of Loui. All his short fighting life, he wrote touching letters to his wife Serafim in the Arkhangel region. Already now, the right-hand man of Alexei Durapov has found front triangles at his grandmother's house and has rebuilt the history of his ancestor, a soldier who gave life to Karelia and our peaceful future.

People of victory
08-10-2021

The victory at Cape Kis-Kis: why now the battles of the Great Patriotic War are reconstructed

Shots, bombs, people in the form of Soviet and Finnish soldiers. In honour of the 77th anniversary of the liberation of Kareliyah from fascist invaders in the Kaleval region, the 1944 battle was rebuilt. The correspondent of the Russians has spoken to those who participated.

People of victory
09-05-2021

" Weapons of the word " : how journalists worked in the war in Carelia

During the war, the Karel Front had more than 100 warlords. Journalists not only collected information, wrote articles and took photographs, but also fought along with frontline fighters. The less-trained pages of the history of the war - the work of the media - were presented by the Lecturer of the History Institute of Petrgo Vitalia Nile. The new edition of the Ludy Victory Project is about our heroic colleagues.

People of victory
27-04-2021

" We must find all " : in Yanishpol, the memory of war heroes was perpetuated

Four years ago, in the Yanishpol Karel village, the initiative residents set up a historic and Ukrainian club called Firsto. There was a strong desire to know the fate of their relatives who had left on the front and had not returned, to perpetuate the memory of all the heroes. In four years of work, 425 warriors have rebuilt the fighting road. Their names are now scattered on the stoves of the brotherly grave in the middle of Yanispol.

People of victory
17-02-2021

" Square pinks " : How were the prisoners of the endzlager in Solomanom

A resident of Petrozavodska Nina Voronina told his parents who had spent almost three years behind barbed wires of Finnish occupationmen in Petrozavodsk. She was born in 1945 in an already exempted city. Her father, mother, grandparents told her about the hard time of occupation.

People of victory
03-02-2021

Seeing and not giving up

Alexei Buinica has not returned from the war. Since then, his family has been searching for any information about him, but only a few years ago, they found that he had died in a labour camp in the village of Pigi. Owing to the perseverance of the boy ' s grandchildren and the disintegration of the Karel authorities in the village, the memory of prisoners of war was perpetuated. The preservation of the monument is followed by local residents.
